page.title: 18Tourism in Rogate
page.content: The church St Bartholomew, shows signs of a round arch dating from 1150 but there may have been a building on the site in Anglo Saxon times.A fine example of a chest possibly used for collecting arms for the Crusades is the oldest piece of furniture inside the vestry. The 16th century bridge at Habin crossing the River Rother and the Chithurst Manor monastery for Buddhists are two attractions on the border of the area surveyed. A network of footpaths cross the fields and woods making it a singularly attractive place to walk and enjoy the landscape and country life. Roe deer from which the village gets its name can still be seen among the trees, all adding to this friendly,beautiful environment.
